column3: I remember some rule that comments should not describe what the code does, but rather *why* the code does (some weird) stuff.\n\nI don't think (de)serialization is weird, so you might as well remove those altogether?
@MarcoFalke I do not have problem with that. Will wait for other comments.
ACK f26da35142c1d8869cb171d3053aaf2ec3f6cca1.\nI'm all in for better comments (can be a different PR).
Yes, in this case, it documents the contents of the file being read.
Fine, just going to merge this.
